data.title: Fabulous Lemon Puffs
data.text: Pollman's Bake shop is a wonderful locally owned bakery. Their lemon puffs melt in your mouth and their french bread is perfectly done, you think you're in New Orleans at an Upscale restaurant. You can have a delicious poboy or a muffaletta and eat it their or bring it home. I love it!

data.title: Mobile favorite forever!
data.text: Great po-boys, egg salad, breakfast pick ups, birthday cakes , cookies etc. Nice owners and staff. lots of cakes breads etc

data.title: Yummy treats!
data.text: I so love their sugar cookies and their chicken salad with chips is a great grab a lunch type thing!

data.title: Little squares of Heaven
data.text: My family visited the Pollman's on Old Shell Road during a recent visit to Mobile.  We had strawberry cake squares and they were delicious. I can remember visiting my grandmother who lived in Mobile until 1980 and going to Pollman's for a treat.  It was as good as I remember.

data.title: A Mobile MUST HAVE!
data.text: The freshly baked cakes are delicious. The chocolate dobash is not to be compared. They sell cakes not sold the day before by the slice. It's a special treat for the kids.

data.title: delicious bakery food
data.text: love pastries, great brownies, cookies and dobage cakes, also love the sandwiches made on bakery bread, the best is rye!

data.title: Tasty Desserts
data.text: I always like to stop in here when I have a sweet tooth. The staff is always helpful and there is a variety of sweets to choose from. The Bear Claws are wonderful, if you haven't tried them, try it some time, also the lemon puffs, so good.

data.title: Best cakes in town
data.text: Pollmans makes the best cakes and pastries ever! I have also been told they make great sandwiches too.

data.title: Good Sweet Treats
data.text: Nice place for a downtown worker to stop by for a sweet treat. They do have some very low price options like some of the donut type treats.

data.title: The Big Bakery In Mobile
data.text: Great cookies, Petit fours, cup cakes, cakes etc. I really like to load up on leftover cookies Mondays after the big games. Day old cookies for a dollar a bag versus  $1.40 a piece. Last about 45 minutes at my house. (LOL)

data.title: Well worth the visit
data.text: We came across Pollman's as we were wandering though. The outside has a very classic old look to it and the inside is not fancy, which I honestly appreciated. The people here were very friendly and we got some cookie and sandwiches. The cookies were very good and the sandwiches, though simple, was some of the best we had with great flavor, especially the roast beef. Often times I avoid roast beef because the meat has no flavor, this was not the case here. We also did the ham sandwich which was equally as good. Don't miss it if you like local and established places.

data.title: Wonderful pastries
data.text: Pollmans has been in Moile a long time. Their baked goods are increditial!!! We love the fresh, delicious flavor!! We love the lemon puffs!!! This bakery is locally owned.

data.title: Hunting something sweet & cheap!
data.text: I'm not a fan of their pre-made sandwiches but dropped in at their downtown location for something sweet and cheap. I bought two bags of yesterday's petit fours to share back at the office. They were $2.75 for bag of 5 and still moist and pretty good. Everyone that got one was happy!

data.title: Bye bye
data.text: Been using this bakery for 39 years. Last time I ordered a cake I said I'd never go back. Decided to give it another try. Prepaid for the cake, picked it up, it was all wrong. Read the order ticket and it was perfect.  As usual it was the cake bakers ~ decorators. They fixed it but I was late for work. The cake was dry when we ate it at our party. I decided to get my husband 2 apple fritters while I was waiting.  When I got home with them and he took them out of the bag, the tops were deceivingly beautiful but the underside was burnt on both. Also, my office mates and I use to get sandwiches there.  No one will anymore.  Too bad.  It once was a wonderful place.

data.title: Gotta get your po'boy here!
data.text: Come to Mobile and get a po'boy from Pollman's. Also get your dessert items too:cakes, petite fore's, etc.

data.title: Great staff
data.text: We ate here twice - once because it was the only place open for lunch on Christmas Day.  The food is OK but formulaic and not very imaginative.  Still our pizza was large and tasty.  They do not serve breakfast.

data.title: The best bakery in town
data.text: Whether you go to the shop on broad street or the shop on old shell, Pollman's is the best in town. They have wonderful treats. The Christmas angel cookies were divine and too much to eat at one time, had to save for later. The sandwiches are yum!!!! Only downfall is sometimes it's so busy you have to wait to find a parking spot. But always worth the wait.

data.title: Wonderful bakery
data.text: I have been a customer for 20 years, and on average go once a week.  Special occasion cookies for Easter, Halloween, Christmas, etc are wonder treats for my children and neighbors.  Everything they bake is wonderful.  My favorite is their Dobash Cake.  Luckily Pollman's makes the Dobash in cupcakes sizes as well as a small cake (10", three layer cakes) size.

data.title: Quick meal for on the go!
data.text: Excellent sandwiches and pastries when you are on the go...Sit in is available and the service is great with a very gracious staff meeting your very need...

data.title: Must have been a bad day at Pollman's
data.text: My elderly parents recently visited me in Mobile.  On the way to my place they stopped in at Pollman's on Broad Street.  It was early on a Wednesday afternoon.  They said the place seemed a bit out of sorts--employees seemed not to be "on the ball," but they weren't sure why.  They ordered several items.  Then they drove to my house, about a half mile away.  At supper that night we opened the Pollman's bag to find lots of unhappy surprises.  The short loafs (sort of like mini French bread) were so hard that they crumbled when cut or broken.  We had to throw them out for the birds.  The baklava was so overwhelmingly greasy that it wasn't a pleasure to eat.  And one of the items they ordered was missing.  I hope this doesn't become a habit.
